Package fileSystem

Class Directory

java.lang.Object
fileSystem.FileSystemObject
fileSystem.Directory
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<FileSystemObject>
public class Directory extends FileSystemObject implements Iterable<FileSystemObject>
This class represents a virtual directory that can hold other FileSystem objects such as file or directory

    • findChild

      public static FileSystemObject findChild​(Directory currentDir, Class<?> classType, String name) throws Exception
      Check if given directory has a child with given type and name
      Parameters:
      currentDir - is given directory
      classType - is the given child type
      name - is the given child name
      Returns:
      child with matching name and type
      Throws:
      Exception - if currentDir directory has no such child

    • findChild

      public static FileSystemObject findChild​(Directory currentDir, String childName) throws Exception
      Check if given directory has a child with given name; if name is '.' refer to current directory, if name is '..' refer to parent directory
      Parameters:
      currentDir - is given directory
      fileName - is the given fileSystemObject name
      Returns:
      child with matching name
      Throws:
      Exception - if this directory has no such child

    • findDirectory

      public static Directory findDirectory​(Directory currentDir, String nextDirectory) throws Exception
      Find next directory by moving either backwards (to parent) or forward (some child directory) from given directory according to the given string
      Parameters:
      currentDir - is the given directory
      nextDirectory - is string that indicates which directory to move to
      Returns:
      directory that matches nextDirectory
      Throws:
      Exception - if cannot move from this directory to directory that matches nextDirectory

    • findDirectory

      public static Directory findDirectory​(Directory currentDir, List<String> listOfDirNames) throws Exception
      Find the directory starting from given directory, moving either backwards (to its parent) or forward (to one of its children) according to the given list of directory names
      Parameters:
      currentDir - is the starting directory
      listOfDirNames - is list of directory names to move through
      Returns:
      directory that is there after moved through the entire list
      Throws:
      Exception - if at some point, next item on the list cannot be moved to from current directory
